sheet_title: 2022 CalGreen AIA Checklist — Residential Mandatory Measures, Sheet 1
description: 2022 California Green Building Standards Code residential mandatory measures checklist (July 2024 Supplement). Covers Chapter 3 (General scope), Chapter 4 Divisions 4.1 through 4.5: Planning and Design (storm water, EV charging), Energy Efficiency, Water Efficiency and Conservation (fixture flow rates, MWELO), Material Conservation and Resource Efficiency (construction waste, moisture), and Environmental Quality (VOC limits, indoor air quality, pollutant control, fireplaces).
key_content: Section 4.106.4: EV charging requirements for new construction — EVCS provisions, Level 2 EV charging, NEMA 14-50 receptacle
Section 4.106.2: Storm water pollution prevention — onsite retention of 85th percentile 24-hour storm event for projects adding/replacing more than 2,500 sqft impervious surface
Section 4.303.1: Kitchen faucets max 1.8 GPM at 60 PSI
Section 4.304.1: Outdoor potable water use references MWELO
Section 4.405.1: Construction waste reduction, disposal, and recycling provisions
Section 4.504.2: Adhesives, sealants, and caulks VOC limits per SCAQMD rules
Section 4.504.3: Paints and coatings — flat coatings 50 g/L VOC, non-flat coatings 100 g/L VOC, SCAQMD Rule 1113
Section 4.505: Bathroom exhaust fans ENERGY STAR rated required
Section 4.506: HVAC minimum filtration requirements (MERV rating)
Section 4.507: Fireplace requirements for residential buildings
APPROVED by Anthony Montes - Building Plan Check
